response:
The subacute presentation (over days) of multifocal CNS signs (brainstem and optic nerve) in a middle-aged female is highly suggestive of an inflammatory demyelinating disorder. Malignancy (specifically CNS lymphoma or brainstem glioma) and granulomatous diseases are critical differentials to exclude.

differential_diagnosis = ["Multiple Sclerosis", "Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (NMOSD)", "MOG Antibody Disease", "Primary CNS Lymphoma", "Neurosarcoidosis", "Brainstem Glioma", "Neuro-Behcet's Disease"]
